body.para: Hi ade; you might find both the answer and an excellent explanation in the post from Mike Williams in answer to my post re: 'Setting a marker & some data to a second map from a tab click on a first map', (http:// groups.google.ca/group/Google-Maps-API/browse_thread/thread/ 53eb4af017834373/65dc5e159a16c0a8#65dc5e159a16c0a8) in which Mike points out 2 essentials:
"...clicks on HTML buttons execute in global context,..." and
"...store a global copy of the data ... to use later, relying on the fact that the API can only ever open one info window at once."
In effect, the onclick does only call the content for the specific marker with the infoWindow open.
